results.title: Time and place
results.creator_credit: Phillip Mark-Law, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A study of our living environment in all its variety. Capturing the mood of today’s living, grasping at images of a graceful, more leisurely past, and examining alternative paths into the future. Without commentary, this deeply perceptive film establishes a basis for comparison of environmental situations, and asks the viewer to make their own choice. Begins with the documentation of Christo’s wrapping of the Sydney cove coastline (shot through a rose coloured lens in the final scenes).

results.title: Timber town
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Looks at life in a timber town located in the hardwood forest area of the southwestern coast of Western Australia. Shows Karri forests, tree felling, reforestation, controlled burning of undergrowth, timber hauling and milling. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Timber sense
results.creator_credit: Tasmania Dept. of Labour and Industry and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production
results.brief_description:
This 1961 film shows some of the ways in which accidents may be prevented in the timber production industry, in forests and sawmills. While working in the forest, the film shows the importance of wearing safety helmets and boots to avoid the danger of falling limbs; creating a clear getaway from felled trunks; and safely loading logs onto a timber truck. It then shows safe practices when working in sawmills, including wearing safety glasses to protect against sawdust and splinters; installing guards on circular saws; and keeping the floor clear.

Produced by the Tasmania Department of Film Production for the Department of Labour and Industry.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Three to go: Michael
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Part of a trilogy concerning the problems of young people in Australia. Michael has to make decisions in the complex but permissive world of today. His friends have followed a relatively straight and narrow path of conformity. Michael has more or less taken this course, but knows that other ways exist. He is prepared to listen to the prophets of change and revolution and is taken on an excursion into the world of the young radical. In which world does Michael belong? Features Grahame Bond. Also available on DVD [319174].

results.title: This is the ABC
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Madeleine Williams and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A survey of Australia’s national radio network and the programs it provides. The network consists of transmitters in the metropolitan areas of the Commonwealth; regional relay transmitters and Radio Australia. The ABC broadcasts a total of 1000 hours of programs every day in the year (1954); various departments compile these programs - News, Sporting, Talks, School Broadcasts etc. The film includes behind-the-scene shots of such programs as Dr Floyd’s Music Lovers’ Hour, Kindergarten of the Air, The Country Hour, Blue Hills and The Village Glee Club. Compered by Rupert Chance.

results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The need for conservation of the edible sharks which are fished off the south coast of Australia has been proved by scientific observation.

results.title: Taxation office
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The workings of the Taxation Department, as explained to a young man joining the department. This film serves as an introduction to new Taxation Department staff, and gives the man in the street an insight as to how the Department functions.

results.title: Sydney's Harbour Bridge
results.brief_description: Important historical documentary which records the construction of Sydney’s Harbour Bridge from 1926 when work was first commenced through to its official opening eight year later. Features footage of dignitaries at the Opening Ceremony including the Governor General, NSW Premier (J.D. Lang) but most significantly, De Groot unceremoniously cutting the ribbon and then being taken away.

results.title: Sydney
results.creator_credit: Joe Scully, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
Presents many and varied aspects of life in Sydney including business and industrial activities, shops and supermarkets, play centres, schools and universities, hospitals and the rapid growth of new buildings. Shows the various recreational choices including football, cricket, surfing, yachting, fishing or just strolling in the beautiful parks and gardens and evening entertainment in the famous Kings Cross with its multitude of night clubs, restaurants and discotheques.

results.title: Summer school in Singapore
results.brief_description: As part of the Colombo Plan thirty-five students from Cambodia and Laos were invited by the United Kingdom Government to attend a summer-school in Singapore for a six-week course in the English language. The school was held in the University of Malaya and the students came from varied walks of life - government officials, teachers and high-school students. Emphasis was laid on conversational English, its rhythm, pronunciation and vocabulary.
